these guys are a Michigan band second

overly dramatic overly emotional whiny
but since they put out this sophomore
album I've been listening to it and I've
I've done a bit of a 180 with these guys
now these dudes get labeled as post
hardcore a lot but don't worry this is
not your crappy average modern post
hardcore where you get the kind of
scream vocals and then you get a
dime-a-dozen kind of breakdown right
after and then right after that you get
all these really cheap sugary ultra
clean vocals kind of swooping in like
when I'm listening to bands who do
vocals like that it's like listening to
a million nyan cats all fly into the
music at once crapping rainbows in every
direction instead this is some of the
most raw urgent and emotionally intense
rock music you're going to hear this
year I think to start off with the
production I think it sounds great the
guitars are sounding fantastic on this
LP they're heavy they're loud they're
blaring when these guys reach like
mountainous climaxes but also they have
very quiet subtle moments to where the
guitars just go soft and don't lose
their flavor in the process these guys
have a lot of dynamics and all of their
energy translates perfectly through this
record sometimes it doesn't even feel
like I'm listening to a record it just
feels like I'm listening to these guys
play live in the studio just sort of
like really in the moment now the bass
and drum sound great they play a lot of
fantastic grooves on this LP and I can
actually hear the
based on here which I like a lot and the
vocals are in an amazing spot on this
thing
they are so audible I hear almost
everything they're saying but yet they
don't feel too much louder than the rest

is pretty pretty good too it's very
ambitious for a rock album of of any

within the new school of post-hardcore
that's been around ever since bands like
